text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

SPEAKER: Open education
here means open resources

in and outside of the
classroom for our students.

SPEAKER: We're inventing
a more open future

for all curious minds by sharing
a treasure of knowledge for you
to discover anywhere, anytime.

SPEAKER: We're rethinking.
open by recognizing

voices and expertise from
people of diverse backgrounds

are absolutely necessary
for expanding and growing
open educational resources.

SPEAKER: 20% of our faculty have
adapted, adopted, and/or created
OER.

SPEAKER: We are inventing a more
open future for all consumers

and producers of
knowledge by leading

in the development of
sustainable open publishing

models and open source
publishing technologies.

SPEAKER: We are
relentless in our pursuit

of a more open and equitable
scholarly landscape.

SPEAKER: Open is democratizing
learning and knowledge
to the world.
SPEAKER: [SPEAKING NON-ENGLISH]

SPEAKER: Here,
open is in our DNA.

SPEAKER: It captures
our commitment

to sharing our best educational
contributions in a way

that everyone can build on
them and make them even better.

SPEAKER: Here, openness
is a core value.

We share information,
innovations,
and ideas with enthusiasm.

We champion OpenCourseWare,
open access, and open science,
all crucial to our mission.
Our doors are open too.
So come join us.
SPEAKER: Come join us.
SPEAKER: Come join us.
SPEAKER: Come invent with us.
SPEAKERS: Come invent with us.

SPEAKER: We can't
wait to welcome you.

SPEAKER: I think you will
enjoy seeing Cambridge,

and I certainly look
forward to meeting you.
So let's do it.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
